PluginClass.PluginDescription: This plugin logs the device's Accelerometer. Note: this does NOT log the user's geographical location/movement
PluginClass.DeveloperDescription: Logged values represent the relative acceleration of the device through space, in m/s^2.

PluginClass.PluginDescription: This plugin logs the device's Gravity Sensor.
PluginClass.DeveloperDescription: This is similar to the Accelerometer plugin, but only measures the influence of gravity. Values are in m/s^2

PluginClass.PluginDescription: This plugin logs the device's gyroscope.
PluginClass.DeveloperDescription: Values are in radians/second and measure the rate of rotation around the device's local X, Y and Z axis. Rotation is positive in the counter-clockwise direction

PluginClass.PluginDescription: This plugin logs the device's Humidity Sensor, measuring the percentage of relative humidity in the air around the device
PluginClass.DeveloperDescription: Logged values represent the ambient relative humidity, in %. Note: not many devices have this sensor, unless you're sure the devices you're going to deploy on are equipped with it, it's recommended to make this logging operation optional.

PluginClass.PluginDescription: This plugin logs the device's Light Sensor, measuring the amount of ambient light around the device
PluginClass.DeveloperDescription: The unit of measurement is lux. Note that, while quite common, this sensor is not found on all devices. Consider making it optional if you can.

PluginClass.PluginDescription: This plugin measures the magnetic field around the device.
PluginClass.DeveloperDescription: The values are measured in microtesla (uT).

PluginClass.PluginDescription: This plugin logs the device's Pressure Sensor, measuring the atmospheric pressure around the device.
PluginClass.DeveloperDescription: Logged values are in millibars. Note: few devices have this sensor, consider marking this as optional if possible.

PluginClass.PluginDescription: This plugin logs the device Proximity Sensor, measuring how far the front of the device is from any solid object.
PluginClass.DeveloperDescription: Normally reports a floating-point value representing the distance between the front of the device from any solid objects, in centimeters. Note however that the unit of measurement is not standard and that some devices may only report a binary value (with '0' meaning 'there's something near the device' and any other value meaning 'there's nothing near the device')
